name: glued solid timber production | glued solid timber | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23396/documentation

This dataset represents the produciton of glued solid timber production, reflecting a sample of German glued solid timber beams production.;Glued solid timber beams are industrially-manufactured products for load-bearing structures. They comprise two or three coniferous wood planks or squared timbers which are glued together by their face sides parallel to grain.;The manufacturing process corresponds with that of glued laminated timber, whereby larger individual cross-sections are glued together. Thanks to their manufacturing process, glued solid timber beams are very dimensionally stable and are only susceptible to minor cracking.;Owing to their high dimensional stability and low moisture content glued solid timber beams are particularly suitable for timber-frame buildings. glued solid timber beams are manufactured from spruce, fir, pine, larch or Douglas fir. Other coniferous species are permissible but not typical.;The standard strength class is C24 or C24M;Reference:;Kollmann F. F. P., Kuenzi E. W. and Stamm A. J. (1975) Principles of Wood Science and Technology. Springer-Verl., Berlin, Heidelberg, New York. AND Nimz H., Schmitt U., Schwab E., Wittmann O. and Wolf F. (1997) Wood. In:  Ullmann"s encyclopedia of indus-trial chemistry (ed. Anonymous). 5th edition on CD-ROM Edition. Wiley & Sons, London.;Rüter, S. and S. Diederichs (2012): Ökobilanz-Basisdaten für Bauprodukte aus Holz. Arbeitsbericht aus dem Institut für Holztechnologie und Holzbiologie Nr. 2012/1, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut (vTI), Hamburg. ;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

From the reception at the factory gate of all materials and fuels used.

This activity ends with the laminated wood beams produced at the factory gate. The dataset includes the inputs to and outputs of the production processes and the available process emissions. Infrastructure is a rough estimate.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/162:Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials/1621:Manufacture of veneer sheets and wood-based panels

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for Germany used for central Europe
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Technology reflects a sample of German glued solid timber beams production.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature; emissions profile per MJ wood input from PSI (2014)

exchanges.description:
Reference product. Plywood produced in Germany by processes representative for European average. The reference product is ready for delivery at the wooden board factory. 
A large number of materials can be produced with differing properties and areas of use. Typical uses are as construction plywood for wall, floor, and ceiling panels and also as panels for concrete shuttering, and decorative covering veneers in interior furnishings (e.g. wall panels or doors).
